chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: Type
f2: R -> R -> T
P: seq R

Goal:
SF_ly (SF_seq_f2 f2 P) = behead (pairmap f2 0 P)

Premises:
Notation seq := list
*** [ R : Set ]
SF_seq_f2 = fun (T : Type) (f2 : R -> R -> T) (P : seq R) => {| SF_h := head 0 P; SF_t := pairmap (fun x y : R => (y, f2 x y)) (head 0 P) (behead P) |} : forall T : Type, (R -> R -> T) -> seq R -> SF_seq Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope seq_scope]
behead = fun (T : Type) (s : seq T) => match s with | [::] => [::] | _ :: s' => s' end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
pairmap = fun (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T1 -> T2) => fix pairmap (x : T1) (s : seq T1) {struct s} : seq T2 := match s with | [::] => [::] | y :: s' => f x y :: pairmap y s' end : forall T1 T2 : Type, (T1 -> T1 -> T2) -> T1 -> seq T1 -> seq T2 Arguments T1, T2 are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope _ seq_scope]
SF_ly = fun (T : Type) (s : SF_seq) => unzip2 (SF_t s) : forall T : Type, SF_seq -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
SF_ly_surj : forall s s0 : SF_seq, s = s0 -> SF_ly s = SF_ly s0 where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_cons_f2 : forall (f3 : R -> R -> ?T) (h : R) (P0 : seq R), (0 < size P0)%nat -> SF_seq_f2 f3 (h :: P0) = SF_cons (h, f3 h (head 0 P0)) (SF_seq_f2 f3 P0) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_lx_ly_inj : forall s s0 : SF_seq, SF_lx s = SF_lx s0 -> SF_ly s = SF_ly s0 -> s = s0 where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_map_ly : forall (f : ?T -> ?T0) (s : SF_seq), SF_ly (SF_map f s) = [seq f i | i <- SF_ly s] where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T0 : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_size_f2 : forall (f3 : R -> R -> ?T) (P0 : seq R), SF_size (SF_seq_f2 f3 P0) = Init.Nat.pred (size P0) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_lx_f2 : forall (f3 : R -> R -> ?T) (P0 : seq R), (0 < size P0)%nat -> SF_lx (SF_seq_f2 f3 P0) = P0 where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
unzip1_behead : forall s : seq (?S * ?T), unzip1 (behead s) = behead (unzip1 s) where ?S : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
unzip2_behead : forall s : seq (?S * ?T), unzip2 (behead s) = behead (unzip2 s) where ?S : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_ly_cons : forall (h : R * ?T) (s : SF_seq), SF_ly (SF_cons h s) = snd h :: SF_ly s where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_ly_nil : forall x0 : R, SF_ly (SF_nil x0) = [::] where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_ly_rev : forall s : SF_seq, SF_ly (SF_rev s) = rev (SF_ly s) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_seq_f1 = fun (T : Type) (f1 : R -> T) (P : seq R) => {| SF_h := head 0 P; SF_t := pairmap (fun x y : R => (y, f1 x)) (head 0 P) (behead P) |} : forall T : Type, (R -> T) -> seq R -> SF_seq Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope seq_scope]
behead_rev : forall s : seq ?T, behead (rev s) = rev (belast s) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
pairmap_rcons : forall (f : ?T -> ?T -> ?T0) (s : seq ?T) (h0 h x0 : ?T), pairmap f x0 (rcons (rcons s h0) h) = rcons (pairmap f x0 (rcons s h0)) (f h0 h) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T0 : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_ly_f1 : forall (f1 : R -> ?T) (P0 : seq R), SF_ly (SF_seq_f1 f1 P0) = belast [seq f1 i | i <- P0] where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_ly_rcons : forall (s : SF_seq) (h : R * ?T), SF_ly (SF_rcons s h) = rcons (SF_ly s) (snd h) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_seq_bij_ly : forall (lx : seq R) (ly : seq ?T) (Hs : size lx = S (size ly)), SF_ly (SF_make lx ly Hs) = ly where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_lx_cat : forall x y : SF_seq, SF_lx (SF_cat x y) = SF_lx x ++ behead (SF_lx y) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
behead_rcons : forall (s : seq ?T) (t : ?T), (0 < size s)%nat -> behead (rcons s t) = rcons (behead s) t where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
seq_step = fun s : seq R => foldr Rmax 0 (pairmap (fun x y : R => Rabs (y - x)) (head 0 s) (behead s)) : seq R -> R Argument scope is [seq_scope]
map_pairmap : forall (f : ?T0 -> ?T1) (g : ?T -> ?T -> ?T0) (s : seq ?T) (x0 : ?T), [seq f i | i <- pairmap g x0 s] = pairmap (fun x y : ?T => f (g x y)) x0 s where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T0 : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T1 : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
pairmap_map : forall (f : ?T0 -> ?T0 -> ?T1) (g : ?T -> ?T0) (s : seq ?T) (x0 : ?T), pairmap f (g x0) [seq g i | i <- s] = pairmap (fun x y : ?T => f (g x) (g y)) x0 s where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T0 : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T1 : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_map_cons : forall (f : ?T -> ?T0) (h : R * ?T) (s : SF_seq), SF_map f (SF_cons h s) = SF_cons (fst h, f (snd h)) (SF_map f s) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type] ?T0 : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_make : forall (lx : seq R) (ly : seq ?T), size lx = S (size ly) -> SF_seq where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_lx_nil : forall x0 : R, SF_lx (SF_nil x0) = [:: x0] where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
SF_size_ly : forall s : SF_seq, size (SF_ly s) = SF_size s where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]
seq_step_cat : forall x y : seq R, (0 < size x)%nat -> (0 < size y)%nat -> last 0 x = head 0 y -> seq_step (x ++ behead y) = Rmax (seq_step x) (seq_step y)
plus_fct = fun (f1 f2 : R -> R) (x : R) => f1 x + f2 x : (R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> R -> R Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope Rfun_scope R_scope]
mult_fct = fun (f1 f2 : R -> R) (x : R) => f1 x * f2 x : (R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> R -> R Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope Rfun_scope R_scope]
SF_size_lx : forall s : SF_seq, size (SF_lx s) = S (SF_size s) where ?T : [T : Type f2 : R -> R -> T P : seq R |- Type]

```coq
unfold SF_ly, SF_seq_f2. rewrite SF_ly_cons, SF_ly_nil. rewrite pairmap_map with (f := fun x y => (y, f2 x y)) (g := fun x => x) (s := behead P) (x0 := 0). auto.
rewrite <- pairmap_map with (f := fun x y => (y, f2 x y)) (g := fun x => x) (s := head 0 P) (x0 := 0). auto.
rewrite <- SF_ly_f2.
Qed.```
